source_id: STP1354-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_12th Volume_003_chunk1
evidence_span: New Zrbased alloys containing niobium or tin or both are being developed with superior resistance to in-reactor corrosion and deformation.

source_id: STP1354-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_12th Volume_003_chunk1
evidence_span: There were no unpleasant surprises in the deformation and microstructure studies of the Zircaloys and of Zr-2.5Nb at high fluences.

source_id: STP1354-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_12th Volume_003_chunk1
evidence_span: There were no unpleasant surprises in the deformation and microstructure studies of the Zircaloys and of Zr-2.5Nb at high fluences.

source_id: STP1354-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_12th Volume_003_chunk1
evidence_span: The solubility limit of hydrogen was shown to have been increased in Zircaloy materials by neutron irradiation

source_id: STP1354-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_12th Volume_003_chunk1
evidence_span: the evidence for a detrimental effect of high concentrations of hydrogen on the corrosion resistance of Zircaloy-4 continues to mount.

source_id: STP1354-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_12th Volume_003_chunk1
evidence_span: Thermomechanical tests have provided data for high-temperature creep laws, burst criteria, and ductility studies of current and new alloys deforming under accident conditions.

source_id: STP1354-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_12th Volume_003_chunk1
evidence_span: Thermomechanical tests have provided data for high-temperature creep laws, burst criteria, and ductility studies of current and new alloys deforming under accident conditions.

source_id: STP1354-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_12th Volume_003_chunk1
evidence_span: There appears to be a crack size effect on the crack growth resistance curves for irradiated Zr-2.5Nb material with high fracture toughness.

source_id: STP1354-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_12th Volume_003_chunk1
evidence_span: The localization of deformation into slip bands in irradiated material has been shown to facilitate the initiation of iodine-induced stress corrosion cracking.

source_id: STP1354-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_12th Volume_003_chunk1
evidence_span: Hydrogen present in Zr alloys induces an increase in the work-hardening rate and in the out-reactor creep resistance.

source_id: STP1354-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_12th Volume_003_chunk1
evidence_span: Hydrogen present in Zr alloys induces an increase in the work-hardening rate and in the out-reactor creep resistance.

source_id: STP1354-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_12th Volume_003_chunk1
evidence_span: In the processing of Zircaloy materials, it was shown that most precipitate growth occurs during the α-annealing stages

source_id: STP1354-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_12th Volume_003_chunk1
evidence_span: materials with lower Sn concentrations have broader particle size distributions.

source_id: STP1354-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_12th Volume_003_chunk1
evidence_span: Optimization work on new alloys suggests that carbon concentrations should be kept below 100 ppm for improved corrosion resistance

source_id: STP1354-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_12th Volume_003_chunk1
evidence_span: sulfur can improve the in-reactor creep resistance.

source_id: STP1354-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_12th Volume_003_chunk1
evidence_span: The in-reactor corrosion resistance of the Zr-1Nb alloy is reported to be very good in PWR coolant with less than 5 ppb oxygen and in the absence of sub-cooled boiling

source_id: STP1354-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_12th Volume_003_chunk1
evidence_span: it appears susceptible to nodule formation when about 20 ppb oxygen is present in the coolant.

source_id: STP1354-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_12th Volume_003_chunk1
evidence_span: Work on the effect of dilute additions of Mo, Nb, or V to zirconium showed that the best corrosion resistance was obtained in out-reactor tests when there was a critical concentration of solute atoms in the matrix and a set of second phase particles with sizes in a desired range.
composition_raw: dilute additions of Mo, Nb, or V

source_id: STP1354-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_12th Volume_003_chunk1
evidence_span: Low tin concentrations in Zircaloy-4 containing less than 40 ppm nitrogen were found to increase the corrosion resistance in out-reactor tests by promoting the formation of a thicker tetragonal ZrO2 layer.

source_id: STP1354-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_12th Volume_003_chunk1
evidence_span: Tests also indicated that there was a benefit from using Zircaloy-4 material with Fe and Cr concentrations above the ASTM range
composition_raw: Fe and Cr concentrations above ASTM range

source_id: STP1354-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_12th Volume_003_chunk1
evidence_span: Work on Zr alloys containing Fe and Cr showed that the Fe improved the out-reactor corrosion resistance, but could lead to the formation of cracks in the oxide and to the pickup of a high fraction of the hydrogen produced by the corrosion reaction.

source_id: STP1354-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_12th Volume_003_chunk1
evidence_span: The major benefit of Cr is to minimize the hydrogen pickup.

source_id: STP1354-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_12th Volume_003_chunk1
evidence_span: In Zr-2.5Nb material the effect of the Nb in the α and β-phases has been studied, and the improved corrosion resistance has been found to be associated with a reduction in the Nb concentration in the α-phase because of the precipitation of β Nb.

source_id: STP1354-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_12th Volume_003_chunk1
evidence_span: A study of the corrosion and hydrogen pickup by Zircaloy-2 in BWRs showed that they could be improved by increasing the number of second phase particles with a diameter larger than 50 nm and lowering the Fe/Cr concentration ratio in the particles.

source_id: STP1354-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_12th Volume_003_chunk1
evidence_span: A study of the corrosion and hydrogen pickup by Zircaloy-2 in BWRs showed that they could be improved by increasing the number of second phase particles with a diameter larger than 50 nm and lowering the Fe/Cr concentration ratio in the particles.

source_id: STP1354-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_12th Volume_003_chunk1
evidence_span: Work with high energy electron irradiation of Zircaloy-2 and Zr-2.5Nb samples showed that the microstructures produced by irradiation damage were similar to those produced by neutron irradiation.

source_id: STP1354-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_12th Volume_003_chunk1
evidence_span: Work with high energy electron irradiation of Zircaloy-2 and Zr-2.5Nb samples showed that the microstructures produced by irradiation damage were similar to those produced by neutron irradiation.

source_id: STP1354-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_12th Volume_003_chunk1
evidence_span: In Zr-2.5Nb both electron and neutron irradiation damage enhanced the precipitation of β-Nb and had similar effects on corrosion.
